Question: i have a static library libsrp.a, i want to make a shared library libsrp.so from it that contains all symbols . please tell me how to make a .so under ubuntu.

thanks

Answer:

1

To create a shared library (SO) from a static library (a) in Ubuntu, you can use the `cd` command to navigate to the directory containing the static library, and then use the `ar` command to create the shared library. 

Here are the commands:

``` 
``` 
cd /home/user/lib
ar rc libsrp.so libsrpa.a
``` 

This will create a shared library (SO) that contains all symbols of the static library (a). 

The `ar` command takes the static library and creates a shared library.
